channel.title: Finance

item.title: Mark Cuban says he doesn’t do calls and prefers email because ‘if we do it by phone, I’m going to forget half the stuff that we talked about’
item.description: Meanwhile, Gen Zers prefer email or text because of their anxiety about talking on the phone.

item.title: It’s New Year’s Day 2026. What’s open and closed?

item.title: Healthcare AI 2026 Enters Its Next Act — Prove It Or Lose It
item.description: As healthcare AI matures in 2026, proof beats promises, trust outperforms technology, and humans reclaim the center of care.

item.title: Feds are hunting teenage hacking groups like ‘Scattered Spider’ who have targeted $1 trillion worth of the Fortune 500 since 2022
item.description: Rogue teens have attacked some 120 companies—including Nike, Chick-fil-A, Instacart, and News Corporation—often posing as IT staff.

item.title: Mortgage rates hit 2025 low as homebuyers catch a break
item.description: Mortgage rates drop to their lowest point in 2025, offering potential relief for homebuyers in today's competitive housing market across the nation.

item.title: Trump narrows Fed chair picks, January decision expected
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's term ends in May 2026, but President Trump plans to pick his replacement by January.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
